00030 Subprocess::Stream::Stream() : fd_(-1) {}
00031 Subprocess::Stream::~Stream() {
00032   if (fd_ >= 0)
00033     close(fd_);
00034 }
00035 
00036 Subprocess::Subprocess() : pid_(-1) {}
00037 Subprocess::~Subprocess() {
00038   // Reap child if forgotten.
00039   if (pid_ != -1)
00040     Finish();
00041 }
00042 
00043 bool Subprocess::Start(const string& command) {
00044   int stdout_pipe[2];
00045   if (pipe(stdout_pipe) < 0)
00046     Fatal("pipe: %s", strerror(errno));
00047   stdout_.fd_ = stdout_pipe[0];
00048 
00049   int stderr_pipe[2];
00050   if (pipe(stderr_pipe) < 0)
00051     Fatal("pipe: %s", strerror(errno));
00052   stderr_.fd_ = stderr_pipe[0];
00053 
00054   pid_ = fork();
00055   if (pid_ < 0)
00056     Fatal("fork: %s", strerror(errno));
00057 
00058   if (pid_ == 0) {
00059     close(stdout_pipe[0]);
00060     close(stderr_pipe[0]);
00061 
00062     // Track which fd we use to report errors on.
00063     int error_pipe = stderr_pipe[1];
00064     do {
00065       // Open /dev/null over stdin.
00066       int devnull = open("/dev/null", O_WRONLY);
00067       if (devnull < 0)
00068         break;
00069       if (dup2(devnull, 0) < 0)
00070         break;
00071       close(devnull);
00072 
00073       if (dup2(stdout_pipe[1], 1) < 0 ||
00074           dup2(stderr_pipe[1], 2) < 0)
00075         break;
00076 
00077       // Now can use stderr for errors.
00078       error_pipe = 2;
00079       close(stdout_pipe[1]);
00080       close(stderr_pipe[1]);
00081 
00082       execl("/bin/sh", "/bin/sh", "-c", command.c_str(), NULL);
00083     } while (false);
00084 
00085     // If we get here, something went wrong; the execl should have
00086     // replaced us.
00087     char* err = strerror(errno);
00088     int unused = write(error_pipe, err, strlen(err));
00089     unused = unused;  // If the write fails, there's nothing we can do.
00090     _exit(1);
00091   }
00092 
00093   close(stdout_pipe[1]);
00094   close(stderr_pipe[1]);
00095   return true;
00096 }
00097 
00098 void Subprocess::OnFDReady(int fd) {
00099   char buf[4 << 10];
00100   ssize_t len = read(fd, buf, sizeof(buf));
00101   Stream* stream = fd == stdout_.fd_ ? &stdout_ : &stderr_;
00102   if (len > 0) {
00103     stream->buf_.append(buf, len);
00104   } else {
00105     if (len < 0)
00106       Fatal("read: %s", strerror(errno));
00107     close(stream->fd_);
00108     stream->fd_ = -1;
00109   }
00110 }
00111 
00112 bool Subprocess::Finish() {
00113   assert(pid_ != -1);
00114   int status;
00115   if (waitpid(pid_, &status, 0) < 0)
00116     Fatal("waitpid(%d): %s", pid_, strerror(errno));
00117   pid_ = -1;
00118 
00119   if (WIFEXITED(status)) {
00120     int exit = WEXITSTATUS(status);
00121     if (exit == 0)
00122       return true;
00123   }
00124   return false;
00125 }
00126 
00127 void SubprocessSet::Add(Subprocess* subprocess) {
00128   running_.push_back(subprocess);
00129 }
00130 
00131 void SubprocessSet::DoWork() {
00132   vector<pollfd> fds;
00133 
00134   map<int, Subprocess*> fd_to_subprocess;
00135   for (vector<Subprocess*>::iterator i = running_.begin();
00136        i != running_.end(); ++i) {
00137     int fd = (*i)->stdout_.fd_;
00138     if (fd >= 0) {
00139       fd_to_subprocess[fd] = *i;
00140       fds.resize(fds.size() + 1);
00141       pollfd* newfd = &fds.back();
00142       newfd->fd = fd;
00143       newfd->events = POLLIN;
00144       newfd->revents = 0;
00145     }
00146     fd = (*i)->stderr_.fd_;
00147     if (fd >= 0) {
00148       fd_to_subprocess[fd] = *i;
00149       fds.resize(fds.size() + 1);
00150       pollfd* newfd = &fds.back();
00151       newfd->fd = fd;
00152       newfd->events = POLLIN;
00153       newfd->revents = 0;
00154     }
00155   }
00156 
00157   int ret = poll(fds.data(), fds.size(), -1);
00158   if (ret == -1) {
00159     if (errno != EINTR)
00160       perror("ninja: poll");
00161     return;
00162   }
00163 
00164   for (size_t i = 0; i < fds.size(); ++i) {
00165     if (fds[i].revents) {
00166       Subprocess* subproc = fd_to_subprocess[fds[i].fd];
00167       if (fds[i].revents) {
00168         subproc->OnFDReady(fds[i].fd);
00169         if (subproc->done()) {
00170           finished_.push(subproc);
00171           std::remove(running_.begin(), running_.end(), subproc);
00172           running_.resize(running_.size() - 1);
00173         }
00174       }
00175     }
00176   }
00177 }
00178 
00179 Subprocess* SubprocessSet::NextFinished() {
00180   if (finished_.empty())
00181     return NULL;
00182   Subprocess* subproc = finished_.front();
00183   finished_.pop();
00184   return subproc;
00185 }
